XQuAD-en-00007 | The history of the United States began with the arrival of Native Americans in North America around 15,000 BC. | What is the origin of the United States? | Native Americans
XQuAD-en-00008 | The history of the United States began with the arrival of Native Americans in North America around 15,000 BC. | Who were the first inhabitants of North America? | Native Americans

XQuAD-en-00010 | The history of the United States began with the arrival of Native Americans in North America around 15,000 BC. | Who were the first people to settle in North America? | Native Americans

prompt.content:
Please generate the first 10 instances of XQuAD English dataset test split. Use the following format:
id | context | question | answers
---|---------|----------|--------
{id1} | {context1} | {question1} | {answers1}
{id2} | {context2} | {question2} | {answers2}
...
.

response:
id | context | question | answers
---|---------|----------|--------
XQuAD-TEST-0001 | The history of the United States began with the arrival of Native Americans in North America around 15,000 BC. | When did the history of the United States begin? | 15,000 BC
XQuAD-TEST-0002 | The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands stretching for over 2,300 kilometers over an area of approximately 344,400 square kilometers. | What is the Great Barrier Reef? | the world's largest coral reef system
XQuAD-TEST-0003 | The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. | Where is the Eiffel Tower located? | Paris, France
XQuAD-TEST-0004 | The human brain is the central organ of the human nervous system, and with the spinal cord makes up the central nervous system. | What is the human brain? | the central organ of the human nervous system
XQuAD-TEST-0005 | The Amazon rainforest, also known in English as Amazonia or the Amazon Jungle, is a moist broadleaf forest that covers most of the Amazon basin of South America. | What is the Amazon rainforest? | a moist broadleaf forest
XQuAD-TEST-0006 | The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China to protect the Chinese states and empires against the raids and invasions of the various nomadic groups of the Eurasian Steppe. | What is the Great Wall of China? | a series of fortifications
XQuAD-TEST-0007 | The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra. | Where is the Taj Mahal located? | Agra, India
XQuAD-TEST-0008 | The moon is an astronomical body orbiting Earth as its only natural satellite. | What is the moon? | an astronomical body
XQuAD-TEST-0009 | The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor within New York City, in the United States. | Where is the Statue of Liberty located? | New York Harbor
XQuAD-TEST-0010 | The Sahara is a desert located on the African continent. | Where is the Sahara located? | on the African continent
